Up to 6 inches of snow may fall in Central, W. Mass.

Forecasters said snow is expected to develop Wednesday, lowering visibility during the morning commute and continuing in the afternoon. (Globe, 4:04 p.m.)
  • Weather Wisdom: Snow will create a slow commute
  • Watch WBZ weather forecast | Check full forecast

Francona: Sox owners don't love baseball

In a new book, former Red Sox manager Terry Francona doesn't paint the Red Sox ownership in a favorable light, saying that baseball is "more of a toy or hobby" to them. (Boston Globe, 2:14 p.m.)
  • Werner: Focus is on the season, not Francona's book
  • 10/8/12 Francona introduced as Indians manager
  • Discuss | 10/12/11 Red Sox dissolved into epic collapse

11 developers vie for Mass. casino rights

Deadline passes for Mass. casino filings

The deadline passed today to file an application and pay a $400,000 fee to have a chance for two casinos licenses, as well as the one slot parlor license. (Globe, 6:36 p.m.)
  • More coverage of casinos in Massachusetts
Inside the Hive

White House petition to remove Swartz's prosecutor hits 25,000 signatures

Following Aaron Swartz's suicide, a petition to remove his former prosecutor, Carmen Ortiz, has the signatures needed to get a White House response. (Boston.com)
